pros: Exceptionally comfortable; Secure fit; Smooth and stable ride; Protection hits the sweet spot; Above average durability; Versatile: running and gym; Best-looking Hoka so far
cons: Not particularly lively; Firmer than other Hokas; Needs some breaking in; Average-at-best grip
RR_verdict: In an attempt to merge the world of road running shoes with fitness sneakers, we found the Hoka Kawana to be versatile enough for gym workouts, CrossFit sessions, and daily short runs. It provides a lot of comfort, durability, and a stable ride to both experienced and beginner runners alike.
use: Gym |, Jogging |, Treadmill |, Walking |, All-day wear
